title: New Asylum Policy Aims to Deliver Quicker Decisions
sub_head: The new policy is intended to shorten the entire process to about six months from the yearslong wait under the current system
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Department of Homeland Security is planning to overhaul the process migrants at the southern border would follow to apply for asylum, a change aimed at delivering quicker decisions, the agency is expected to announce Thursday.
The policy, which Biden administration officials outlined to reporters in a call Wednesday evening, could amount to one of the most consequential changes to border processing in recent years if implemented as intended.
